It wasn't my intent to reason "If the language does not support it, then it=
 is a hack." It was my intent to reason "If an implementation 'pattern' exi=
sts to combat a weakness in the design of a framework, then it is a hack."
=

But that's quite interesting -- the link you provided.

Take care.

So sai=
d Bill de h=D3ra on 4/5/2003 --------------------
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
=

[[[
I do not react well to calling J2EE implementation idioms "patterns".
=
They are hacks designed to increase performance and work around the
obvious=
 limitations and faulty intentions of J2EE.
]]]

You can take this reasonin=
g quite a-ways:

  http://norvig.com/design-patterns/img010.gif

to the poi=
nt where if you're not using Lisp or something very like 
it, most patterns=
 are hacks.

In the meantime... ;)

Bill de h=D3ra
